page.title: 01THE LYDFORD AREA
page.content: This area is easily divided into separate regions. There are two Forestry Commission regions on the Western side,a central region of Mixed Farming, the Village area and on the Eastern side a Moorland area with Hill Farming. The land slopes gently upward from West to East at a height of from 600 feet rising to 800 feet. All goods travel by road usually via the A30 trunk road and the A386 Hatherleigh-Tavistock road. After Farming and Forestry the main employment is catering for the needs of Tourists with Caravan Sites, Pony Trekking,Hotels, Bed&Breakfast and the Lydford Gorge.
